newsitem.title: USA: Universal Pictures production chief departs.
newsitem.headline: Universal Pictures production chief departs.

text.p: MCA Inc, the entertainment arm of Seagram Co Ltd, said on Monday that Hal Lieberman was leaving his post as president of production at its Universal Pictures studio.
Lieberman would form an independent company that has a multiyear deal to produce films for Universal, MCA said.
The company has not named a successor to Lieberman.

At Universal, Lieberman oversaw the production of hit movies such "The Nutty Professor" and "Apollo 13." He also supervised upcoming film releases such as "Daylight," starring Sylvester Stallone, and "Dante's Peak," with Pierce Brosnan.
"It has been a wonderful and rewarding run at Universal," Lieberman said in a statement.
